title.rendered: Tickets for the Copa del Rey final have been sold out in minutes – LaOchoTV

content.rendered:
Valencia CF has put the tickets for the Copa del Rey final on sale today, which have sold out in less than 40 minutes.

The situation has produced many protests from fans considering that it has been a “cheating” cast. At first, Valencia CF had reported that around 18,000 tickets of the 21,000 received by the club would be for subscribers, but the truth is that only 13,565 meet the criteria they ask for to get a seat.

In order to buy a ticket, the fan had to have been a club subscriber for eight consecutive years, a measure that directly rules out the smallest to attend the game. In addition, the second criterion was to have attended 80% of the matches at the Mestalla this season.

Such has been the avalanche of fans who were expectant at 10:00 am to buy tickets, that the Valencia CF website has collapsed during the first few minutes. In total, 12,745 tickets have been sold, that is, more than 820 subscribers who met the stated requirements have not obtained a ticket.

At the time, the club had announced that it was going to reserve 3,200 tickets for its “institutional commitments”. Therefore, there are 4,725 tickets left over that are neither for subscribers nor for commitments, so the club has moved this Monday that they will go on sale for VIP subscribers of the Mestalla Camp, fans from other parts of the world who cannot be subscribers , Valencia CF Soccer Players Association, VCF Academy players, partner schools, Small Shareholders Association and employees.
